^0.8.20;\n\nimport \"./USDCToken.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/security/ReentrancyGuard.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title MoneyPot\n * @dev MoneyPot contract that inherits from USDCToken and implements the MoneyPot functionality\n * @notice This contract combines USDC token functionality with MoneyPot game mechanics\n *\n * Architecture:\n * - Inherits from USDCToken for ERC20 functionality and token economics\n * - Implements MoneyPot game logic with built-in USDC token\n * - Maintains separation of concerns: token logic in parent, game logic here\n */\ncontract MoneyPot is USDCToken {\n    using SafeERC20 for USDCToken;\n\n    // Constants\n    uint256 public constant DIFFICULTY_MOD = 3;\n    uint256 public constant HUNTER_SHARE_PERCENT = 40;\n    uint256 public constant CREATOR_ENTRY_FEE_SHARE_PERCENT = 50;\n\n    // State variables\n    address public trustedOracle;\n\n    // Structs\n    struct MoneyPotData {\n        uint256 id;\n        address creator;\n        uint256 totalAmount;\n        uint256 fee;\n        uint256 createdAt;\n        uint256 expiresAt;\n        bool isActive;\n        uint256 attemptsCount;\n        address oneFaAddress;\n    }\n\n    struct Attempt {\n        uint256 id;\n        uint256 potId;\n        address hunter;\n        uint256 expiresAt;\n        uint256 difficulty;\n        bool isCompleted;\n    }\n\n    // State\n    uint256 public nextPotId;\n    uint256 public nextAttemptId;\n    mapping(uint256 => MoneyPotData) public pots;\n    mapping(uint256 => Attempt) public attempts;\n    uint256[] private potIds;\n\n    // Events\n    event PotCreated(\n        uint256 indexed id,\n        address indexed creator,\n        uint256 timestamp\n    );\n    event PotAttempted(\n        uint256 indexed attemptId,\n        uint256 indexed potId,\n        address indexed hunter,\n        uint256 timestamp\n    );\n    event PotSolved(\n        uint256 indexed potId,\n        address indexed hunter,\n        uint256 timestamp\n    );\n    event PotFailed(\n        uint256 indexed attemptId,\n        address indexed hunter,\n        uint256 timestamp\n    );\n    event PotExpired(\n        uint256 indexed potId,\n        address indexed creator,\n        uint256 timestamp\n    );\n\n    // Errors\n    error InvalidFee();\n    error PotNotActive();\n    error ExpiredPot();\n    error NotExpired();\n    error AttemptExpired();\n    error AttemptCompleted();\n    error Unauthorized();\n\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Initialize the MoneyPot contract\n     * @param _trustedOracle Address of the trusted oracle\n     */\n    function initialize(address _trustedOracle) public initializer {\n        // Initialize the parent USDCToken contract\n        super.initializeToken(); // Contract owns the initial supply\n\n        // Set MoneyPot specific parameters\n        trustedOracle = _trustedOracle;\n    }\n\n    function createPot(\n        uint256 amount,\n        uint256 durationSeconds,\n        uint256 fee,\n        address oneFaAddress\n    ) external nonReentrant returns (uint256) {\n        if (fee > amount) revert InvalidFee();\n\n        uint256 id = nextPotId++;\n\n        pots[id] = MoneyPotData({\n            id: id,\n            creator: msg.sender,\n            totalAmount: amount,\n            fee: fee,\n            createdAt: block.timestamp,\n            expiresAt: block.timestamp + durationSeconds,\n            isActive: true,\n            attemptsCount: 0,\n            oneFaAddress: oneFaAddress\n        });\n\n        potIds.push(id);\n        _transfer(msg.sender, address(this), amount);\n\n        emit PotCreated(id, msg.sender, block.timestamp);\n        return id;\n    }\n\n    function attemptPot(uint256 potId) external nonReentrant returns (uint256) {\n        MoneyPotData storage pot = pots[potId];\n\n        if (!pot.isActive) revert PotNotActive();\n        if (block.timestamp >= pot.expiresAt) revert ExpiredPot();\n\n        uint256 entryFee = pot.fee;\n        uint256 creatorShare = (entryFee * CREATOR_ENTRY_FEE_SHARE_PERCENT) /\n            100;\n        uint256 platformShare = entryFee - creatorShare;\n\n        _transfer(msg.sender, pot.creator, creatorShare);\n        _transfer(msg.sender, address(this), platformShare);\n\n        pot.attemptsCount++;\n\n        uint256 attemptId = nextAttemptId++;\n        uint256 difficulty = (pot.attemptsCount % DIFFICULTY_MOD) + 2;\n\n        attempts[attemptId] = Attempt({\n            id: attemptId,\n            potId: potId,\n            hunter: msg.sender,\n            expiresAt: block.timestamp + 300,\n            difficulty: difficulty,\n            isCompleted: false\n        });\n\n        emit PotAttempted(attemptId, potId, msg.sender, block.timestamp);\n        return attemptId;\n    }\n\n    function attemptCompleted(\n        uint256 attemptId,\n        bool status\n    ) external nonReentrant {\n        if (msg.sender != trustedOracle) revert Unauthorized();\n\n        Attempt storage attempt = attempts[attemptId];\n        MoneyPotData storage pot = pots[attempt.potId];\n\n        if (!pot.isActive) revert PotNotActive();\n        if (block.timestamp >= pot.expiresAt) revert ExpiredPot();\n        if (block.timestamp >= attempt.expiresAt) revert AttemptExpired();\n        if (attempt.isCompleted) revert AttemptCompleted();\n\n        attempt.isCompleted = true;\n\n        if (status) {\n            pot.isActive = false;\n\n            uint256 hunterShare = (pot.totalAmount * HUNTER_SHARE_PERCENT) /\n                100;\n            uint256 platformShare = pot.totalAmount - hunterShare;\n\n            _transfer(address(this), attempt.hunter, hunterShare);\n            _burn(address(this), platformShare); // Burn the platform share\n\n            emit PotSolved(attempt.potId, attempt.hunter, block.timestamp);\n        } else {\n            emit PotFailed(attemptId, attempt.hunter, block.timestamp);\n        }\n    }\n\n    function expirePot(uint256 potId) external nonReentrant {\n        MoneyPotData storage pot = pots[potId];\n\n        if (!pot.isActive) revert PotNotActive();\n        if (block.timestamp < pot.expiresAt) revert NotExpired();\n\n        pot.isActive = false;\n        _transfer(address(this), pot.creator, pot.totalAmount);\n\n        emit PotExpired(potId, pot.creator, block.timestamp);\n    }\n\n    // View functions\n    function getBalance(address account) external view returns (uint256) {\n        return balanceOf(account);\n    }\n\n    function getPots() external view returns (uint256[] memory) {\n        return potIds;\n    }\n\n    function getActivePots() external view returns (uint256[] memory) {\n        uint256 count = 0;\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < potIds.length; i++) {\n            if (pots[potIds[i]].isActive) count++;\n        }\n\n        uint256[] memory active = new uint256[](count);\n        uint256 index = 0;\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < potIds.length; i++) {\n            if (pots[potIds[i]].isActive) {\n                active[index++] = potIds[i];\n            }\n        }\n        return active;\n    }\n\n    function getPot(uint256 potId) external view returns (MoneyPotData memory) {\n        return pots[potId];\n    }\n\n    function getAttempt(\n        uint256 attemptId\n    ) external view returns (Attempt memory) {\n        return attempts[attemptId];\n    }\n\n    // ============ ADMIN FUNCTIONS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Update verifier address (only owner)\n     */\n    function updateVerifier(address _verifier) external onlyOwner {\n        require(_verifier != address(0), \"Invalid verifier\");\n        trustedOracle = _verifier;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x8f42790a6c30a7881c8ea81426862735c5a92008107e917444749ae6e46710ec","license":"MIT"},"contracts/moneypot/USDCToken.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20PermitUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20PausableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/OwnableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/security/ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20CappedUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20BurnableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/UUPSUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20Upgradeable.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title USDCToken\n * @dev USDC token contract with hardcoded supply and cap\n * @notice This contract provides USDC token functionality with upgradeable features\n *\n * Key Features:\n * - ERC20 token with upgradeable functionality\n * - Hardcoded initial supply: 1,000,000 USDC (1M tokens)\n * - Hardcoded cap: 10,000,000 USDC (10M tokens)\n * - Owner-controlled minting and burning\n * - Pausable functionality\n * - Permit functionality for gasless approvals\n * - 6 decimals (standard for USDC)\n */\ncontract USDCToken is\n    Initializable,\n    ERC20PermitUpgradeable,\n    ERC20PausableUpgradeable,\n    ERC20CappedUpgradeable,\n    ERC20BurnableUpgradeable,\n    OwnableUpgradeable,\n    ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable,\n    UUPSUpgradeable\n{\n    // Constants\n    uint256 public constant INITIAL_SUPPLY = 10_000_000 * 10 ** 6; // 10M USDC with 6 decimals\n    uint256 public constant MAX_SUPPLY = 10_000_000_000 * 10 ** 6; // 10000M USDC with 6 decimals\n\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Initialize the USDCToken contract\n     */\n    function initializeToken() public {\n        // cuz we are using integrated Token+Contract method\n        string memory name_ = \"Money Pot\";\n        string memory symbol_ = \"USDC\";\n\n        __ERC20_init(name_, symbol_);\n        __ERC20Permit_init(name_);\n        __ERC20Capped_init(MAX_SUPPLY);\n        __Pausable_init();\n        __Ownable_init();\n        __ReentrancyGuard_init();\n        __UUPSUpgradeable_init();\n\n        address _initialOwner = msg.sender;\n\n        // Mint initial supply to the initial owner\n        _mint(_initialOwner, INITIAL_SUPPLY);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Authorize contract upgrades (only owner)\n     */\n    function _authorizeUpgrade(\n        address newImplementation\n    ) internal override onlyOwner {}\n\n    // ============ ADMIN FUNCTIONS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Pause contract (only owner)\n     */\n    function pause() external onlyOwner {\n        _pause();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Unpause contract (only owner)\n     */\n    function unpause() external onlyOwner {\n        _unpause();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Mint tokens (only owner)\n     * @param to Address to mint tokens to\n     * @param amount Amount of tokens to mint\n     */\n    function mint(address to, uint256 amount) external onlyOwner {\n        _mint(to, amount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Burn tokens from account (only owner)\n     * @param from Address to burn tokens from\n     * @param amount Amount of tokens to burn\n     */\n    function burn(address from, uint256 amount) external {\n        require(\n            msg.sender == from || msg.sender == owner(),\n            \"Only the owner of the token or the token holder can burn tokens\"\n        );\n        _burn(from, amount);\n    }\n\n    // ============ INTERNAL FUNCTIONS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Override _mint to respect cap\n     */\n    function _mint(\n        address to,\n        uint256 amount\n    ) internal override(ERC20Upgradeable, ERC20CappedUpgradeable) {\n        super._mint(to, amount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Override _beforeTokenTransfer to handle all token transfers\n     */\n    function _beforeTokenTransfer(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 amount\n    ) internal override(ERC20Upgradeable, ERC20PausableUpgradeable) {\n        super._beforeTokenTransfer(from, to, amount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Override decimals to return 6 (standard for USDC)\n     */\n    function decimals() public pure override returns (uint8) {\n        return 6;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x09bf76e708361febbb539efd8afe3085aecce9c51371584df74eb3a2631bd12f","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

devdoc.details: MoneyPot contract that inherits from USDCToken and implements the MoneyPot functionality

AdminChanged(address,address).details: Emitted when the admin account has changed.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

BeaconUpgraded(address).details: Emitted when the beacon is changed.

EIP712DomainChanged().details: MAY be emitted to signal that the domain could have changed.

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Paused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

Unpaused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().details: Returns the domain separator used in the encoding of the signature for {permit}, as defined by {EIP712}.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

burn(uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from the caller. See {ERC20-_burn}.

burnFrom(address,uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, deducting from the caller's allowance. See {ERC20-_burn} and {ERC20-allowance}. Requirements: - the caller must have allowance for ``accounts``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

cap().details: Returns the cap on the token's total supply.

decimals().details: Override decimals to return 6 (standard for USDC)

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

nonces(address).details: Returns the current nonce for `owner`. This value must be included whenever a signature is generated for {permit}. Every successful call to {permit} increases ``owner``'s nonce by one. This prevents a signature from being used multiple times.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Sets `value` as the allowance of `spender` over ``owner``'s tokens, given ``owner``'s signed approval. IMPORTANT: The same issues {IERC20-approve} has related to transaction ordering also apply here. Emits an {Approval} event. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `deadline` must be a timestamp in the future. - `v`, `r` and `s` must be a valid `secp256k1` signature from `owner` over the EIP712-formatted function arguments. - the signature must use ``owner``'s current nonce (see {nonces}). For more information on the signature format, see the https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612#specification[relevant EIP section]. CAUTION: See Security Considerations above.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

devdoc.title: MoneyPot

userdoc.notice: This contract combines USDC token functionality with MoneyPot game mechanics Architecture: - Inherits from USDCToken for ERC20 functionality and token economics - Implements MoneyPot game logic with built-in USDC token - Maintains separation of concerns: token logic in parent, game logic here
